Configuring the Task Scheduler
In order to
automatically perform an action
in the System, you need to create a
schedule for its launch
. The start time is set
in CRON format
.
To create several automatic actions for one schedule, go to the "Task Scheduler" menu item and click
to create a new object.
In the new registry profile, you need to fill in general settings:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the name of the setting.
Schedule of operation
Entering the start period of the algorithm ((for more information, see
CRON Scheduler
).
The "Schedule is active" switch
This switch confirms the launch of the system action according to the schedule. However, it’s advised to activate it
only after configuring all the settings
.
When setting up a schedule, you need to fill in the general settings without changing the state of the "Schedule is valid" switch. Then you should create new system actions in the "Task Scheduler" child attribute without changing the state of the "Schedule is active" switch in the action profile.
After that, you can activate the switch and save the data.
Then, the "Schedule is valid" switch of the previously configured system action profiles will be activated.
In a similar way, the user can cancel the schedule action for all system actions by disabling the "Schedule is valid" switch in the general schedule settings.
After
saving the schedule profile with the active attribute "Schedule is valid", the user can
disable
the execution of certain tasks by changing the settings.
Remember that actions with the
active switch
related to an
inactive schedule
will not be performed, as the work time will not be connected to actions.
System Action settings
The user can configure system actions by clicking
in the "Task Scheduler" child attribute.
After that, a window with possible types of system actions will appear on the user’s screen.
After selecting the required type of action, the user will see a window with the settings of the system action, which may differ depending on the selected type. Let’s take a look at examples of setting up a schedule to run:
Algorithm
;
Calculation
;
ETL
.
Other actions are configured similarly. The number of system actions may vary depending on the increase in the functionality of the System.
